api:address.api:line: Pam Liversidge Building, Sir Frederick Mappin Building

api:field.name: overview-html

api:html-text.plain-text:
Dr James Law is the Director of Innovation and Knowledge Exchange at Sheffield Robotics and holds a joint post as Senior Innovation Fellow between the Department of Computer Science and the Advanced Manufacturing Research Centre’s Integrated Manufacturing Group (part of the High Value Manufacturing Catapult) at the University of Sheffield. He is a roboticist with strengths in interdisciplinary research and knowledge exchange, and a PI/Co-I on awards of over £6.1M in areas spanning computer science, control engineering, psychology, and design.
James leads activity on collaborative robotics at Sheffield, working with industrial and academic partners to address both the technical and human challenges raised by human-robot collaboration. His work places particular emphasis on building trust and confidence in technology via stakeholder participation in research, and developing pathways to translate academic research into industrial processes. He is PI on the £620k CSI:Cobot project, funded by the Assuring Autonomy International Programme, developing methods to support safety and security co-assurance for collaborative robots in industrial environments, Co-I on the £3M EPSRC Trustworthy Autonomous Systems programme node in Resilience, and Co-I on the DTHIVE project on digital twins for high-value engineering.
James is an executive board member of the EPSRC UK Robotics and Autonomous Systems network (UK-RAS), a member of the EPSRC Early Career Forums in Engineering and Manufacturing Research, and a Senior member of the IEEE.
